title: 114_hr108
content: AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code, states that Members of Congress will no longer be covered by the retirement system, and no further contributions will be made on their behalf. This amendment does not affect any existing rights or benefits under the subchapter. Members of Congress will no longer be covered by the retirement system, and no further contributions will be made on their behalf. This does not affect any existing rights or benefits under the subchapter. Participation in the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations for implementation will be handled by specific authorities. The Executive Director will prescribe the Savings Plan. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress. Amendments related to the Federal Employees' Retirement System. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress effective after the first day of the first Congress following the enactment. No further Government contributions or deductions from basic pay for Members after completing 5 years of service. After completing 5 years of service, Government contributions or deductions from basic pay for Members of Congress cease. New Members are not subject to this chapter and no contributions are made to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund for them. After 5 years of service, Government contributions to Members of Congress cease. This does not affect any prior rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter. Members remain eligible to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations for implementation are under the authority of the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. After 5 years of service, Government contributions to Members of Congress cease, but they can still participate in the Thrift Savings Plan under regulations set by the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress after 5 years of service.
